properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 2:09PM PST until January 6 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...IMPACTFUL SNOW FOR THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH MONDAY...

.Pacific moisture continues to overspread the region and bring
snow for the mountains. Several inches of snow will fall on
Snoqualmie and White Passes through Monday. Snow accumulations
will be in feet on area mountains. Multiple rounds of snow for the
Blue Mountains also expected through Monday where 3 to 9 inches
are expected. Breezy winds could lead to areas of blowing snow.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations
of 3 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Areas of
blowing snow possible.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon, including Highway 204 and
Interstate 84.

* WHEN...From 4 AM to 7 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 7 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
